# Summary 
### Japan and Happiest Countries
- *Freedom to life Choices* - just like what I said in the begining, following rules and not sticking out from others is Japan's way of living. Being an unique in Japan is still a challenge for the country. 
- *Gaenerosity* - I was a little shocked to see the result. Japanese people are pretty generous, they are very kind and group oriented. But compared to european countries, maybe they are not still catching up.
- *Perceptions of Corruption* - I haven't heard that much goverment corruption issues, but something like retired public servants take up lucrative private sector roles in retirement, is known as corruption in Japan. Some embezzlement between politicans and other big well known corporations, etc, are the main issues. 

### Japan and Worst Countries
- *Social Support* - Japan is a peaceful and well-organized country. Japanese government has a good health care system, public transportations, and education systems, that would give people in Japan comfortable. 
- *Perceptions of Corruptions* - It is still a decent country compared to the worst countries. 

## Japan is a very beautiful, clean, and organized country that almost everyone wants to visit, but it is not the perfect for people who wants to live in an unique society. It is a very strict and deciplined society. If you go to school or work there, you would know! If you don't want to follow the country's idea, maybe it might be hard for the person to live there for a long time. This project taught me great points of Japanese view of living there.
